transcript:
into a general roar that only an army of several thousand men could produce. The lights spread farther and farther, probably along the line of the French camp. Rost6v no longer wanted to sleep. The gay triumphant shouting of the enemy army had a stimulating effect on him. "Vive I'Empereur! VEmpereur!" he now heard distinctly. 
"They can't be far off, probably just beyond the stream," he said to the hussar beside him. 
The hussar only sighed without replying and coughed angrily. The sound of
